ProfessionalSummary:
• Managed large scale UI/UX teams, interacted with product managers, business and other stake holders as UX lead.
• Experienced with all stages of a user-centered design process from User Research, Conceptual Modeling, Interaction Design (ID), and Visual Design to Prototyping, Heuristic evaluation and Usability Testing with strong HCI and Scenario Focused Engineering.
• Experienced in all stages of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - working with stake holders, gather functional specification requirement (discovery), high-level design, visual design, business reviews etc.
• Worked extensively with product owners and stake holders to estimate, plan and execute the project in waterfall as well as agile.
• Strong knowledge and experience in Visualization Skills. Exposure in designing responsive web design (RWD). Experienced in conducting and managing research and usability testing initiatives. Good exposure in Usability testing in Usability Lab using TechSmith Morae platform for a leading pharmacy in USA.
• Very well versed with Agile Scrum, SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) methodology in distributed teams, long working experience as Agile Scrum team member. Well versed with agile project management tools tile Ralley, Jeera, and version one.
• Extensive experience in learning content development (eLearning). Worked with Instructional Designer to convert complex scenarios to simple step by step process animations to make learning simple and interesting.
• Extensive experience in visual story boarding and developing concepts. Designed corporate presentations, intro animations etc.
• Exposure in Print media technology, experience in Flash based Corporate Presentation
• Worked in diversified industry domain like Banking & Finance, Retail, Manufacturing and Hi-Tech etc. Experienced in managing creative and functional areas of project.

Name.Raw: Post Graduate Diploma in Advertising and Public Relations

EducationDetails.Text: • Post Graduate Diploma in Advertising and Public Relations from Symbiosis Institute of Business Management (SIBM), Pune 1998.

• Bachelor of Science, June 1996, Nagpur University, India. Diploma Program in Computer Arts, June 1999, Arena Multimedia, Pune, India.

Workshop: Art And Science of Effective Web and Application Design

Scrum Alliance Certified Scrum Master (CSM)

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Information Technology (QA and QC); and User Experience.    ~~~~~~~~   has 15 years of work experience, with 6 years of management experience, including a low-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 3/1/2018, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 19 months:
	Title: Lead Experience Design for Best Buy, Best Buy. POS
Starting on 11/1/2014, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 14 months:
	Title: Sr. UX Designer and Agile Coach for Westpac Bank
Starting on 10/1/2011, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years and 5 months:
	Title: Lead User Experience Designer (UX Architect) for Santander Consumer
Starting on 9/1/2007, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 5 months:
	Title: Lead Designer for Microsoft, GE, eLearning

Positions.Description:
Team: Order Create and Manage (OCAM) and Fulfilment

Description:
Best Buy is a leading provider of technology products, services and solutions. The company offers expert service at an unbeatable price to the consumers, small business owners and educators who visit Best Buy stores, engage with Geek Squad Agents or use    ~~~~~~   or the Best Buy app.

Order Create and Manage is very important area of operations contributing to major revenue for Best Buy. But with major revenue it is also a very complex in nature. A simple order goes through order create, manage and fulfilment which is a multi-disciplinary process. UX plays a major role in making it easy and quick for user to use.

Projects: OCAM and Fulfilment
Responsibilities:
• Partner with PM (Product Manager) to understand the Product Vision and Strategy.
• Conduct weekly meetings with PMs to understand new features and future enhancements.
• Support their timelines and goals by sequencing UX work to deliver the right work at the right time.
• Know what problem(s) we aim to solve and why (business and user).
• Work with the Product Team, Business SMEs, EX Strategy & Research to validate that a real problem has been identified.
• Gain alignment on the problem statement.
• Clearly communicate the problem, the high-level direction and then collaborate on the final solutions.
• Drive the daily work, process and meeting cadence.
• Find answers to Designer questions.
• Keep your manager up to date on the work and roadblocks.
• High level design to detail design which includes wireframes, visual design, pattern library and prototyping.


Environment: Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator & Axure and Invision, HCI: UX team,    ~~~~~~~~  , Interaction Design Foundation (   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ), expert reference material, case studies, inputs from research team etc.

Team: POS (Point of Service)

Description:
Point of Service (POS) is one of the signature tools of Best Buy. POS is mainly a service tool which includes a tendering as well as product return. Integrated returns enables the return of the heavy appliances which are not easy to carry from home to store. Integrated return makes the return very efficient through POS.

Projects: POS, Integrated Return
Responsibilities:
• Identify the upcoming product features
• Define the road map for the features with business
• Work closely with business and product owners to define the timeline
• Review and manage the deliverables and make sure the deliverables are on time.
• Understand the business process and requirements of integrated return.
• Analyze the current issues and problems of the user while returning.
• Review the user journey map for integrated return process, validate the user journey with business and IT
• Review the regular work with team as well as set regular cadence with business and other stake holders to review work.
• Create prototype for Usability testing to be conducted with actual users in filed.
• Partner with the researcher during the research study to conduct usability testing on Integrated Return.
• Analysis of feedback received from field and present it to the business.
• Implement the feedback prioritized by business.
• QA testing and log the issues found. Retest the to make sure the issues are fixed.


Environment: Jeera, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator & Axure and Invision, HCI: UX team,    ~~~~~~~~  , Interaction Design Foundation (   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ), expert reference material, case studies, inputs from research team etc.

Description:
Activations plays a very important role in generating revenue in Best Buy. The current activation system has its own issues in addition to the slow activation speed. The CASE prepaid activations has been designed to complete activation at a faster pace than existing.

Projects: CASE Mobile Activations
Responsibilities:
• Participate in discovery sessions to dig in more information and granular details required to create user
journey maps.
• Create user journey maps and flow chars to identify how user will navigate through various stages of activations.
• Partner with Business Associates and Developers to understand the overall flow of activating a single device
• Detail User Story Analysis to identify deliverable and other artifacts needed to complete the task successfully.
• Account for exceptions and error scenario to make sure the user is properly instructed to recover from error.
• Task analysis and high-level design, wireframes keeping the end user in mind.
• Collaborate with team members and conduct/participate in white board sessions to refine the design and creating robust interactions.
• Convert high level design into a visual design through an iterative process
• In depth interaction analysis and design.
• Create a prototype using Axure, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator and Invision to share the design with all stake holders.
• Conduct a review meeting with all stake holder and seek feedback.
• Update the prototype based on feedback and business priority
• Hand off the design to developers and support development by answering the queries.
• Daily scrum meeting with project team to update the team on task status and any impediments.


Environment: Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator & Axure and Invision, HCI: UX team,    ~~~~~~~~  , Interaction Design Foundation (   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ), expert reference material, case studies etc.

Project: Web Application Dev

Description:
Comerica, Inc. is an American financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas. It has retail-banking operations in Michigan, Texas, Arizona, California and Florida, with select business operations in several other U.S. states, as well as in Canada and Mexico. Comerica is among the 25 largest U.S. financial holding companies. The company's operating units include the Business Bank, the Retail Bank, and Wealth Management.

Comerica Bank is in process of redefining User Experience and trying to establish a dedicated User Experience practice which will work with various department in banks to build the User Experience Synergy.

Projects: # WM CRM (Wealth Management CRM) - User Research
# UX Practice Setup (Branding, Defining UX processes)

Responsibilities:
• Closely work with business to identify the CRM users from Wealth Management  domain
• Set up meeting with Wealth Management Team to coordinate and conduct User Research
• Conduct actual user research which includes
* Task Analysis
* Contextual Interview
* Actual User Interview
* Create Personas based on the Interview which would cover the user base
• Demo the interview findings in Sprint Demo to all stake holders
• Gap analysis of WM CRM
• E-CRM branding
• UX Practice branding and involve in promoting UX Practice through various activities like


Environment: Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator & Axure, HCI: UX team,    ~~~~~~~~  , expert reference material, case studies etc.

Project: JB Hunt 360

Description:
J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc., one of the largest transportation logistics companies in North America, provides safe and reliable transportation services to a diverse group of customers throughout the continental United States, Canada and Mexico. Utilizing an integrated, multimodal approach, JB Hunt provide capacity-oriented solutions cantered on delivering customer value and industry-leading service.
JB Hunt is re modelling and reimagining all desktop, responsive and Mobile apps match the new Digital standards of the industry. The products has been branded as JB Hunt 360.

Projects: # JB Hunt 306 Shipper Reports (Desktop)
# JB Hunt 360 Carrier Invoicing (Desktop, Responsive and Mobile App)

Responsibilities:
• Closely work with business and for initial user research
• Translate the business requirements into wireframes & with the help of basic user research
• Provide simple solution to complex business problems
• Brainstorming sessions with team to conceptualize the screens and workflow
• Concept design, wireframes and paper prototypes based on various user journeys
• Define Personas, user journeys and scenarios using StoryboardThat
• Information Architecture and Information Design
• UX review of the wireframes with business and stakeholders
• Visual Design aligned with brand guidelines
• Effectively communicate design ideas both independently & in teams.
• Creating the interactive prototype using UXPin and review of the prototype with product and business teams
• Detail documentation of interactions using Polarian
• Further enhancement of the website based on the feedback received for the prototype

Environment: Word, PowerPoint, UXPin, StoryboardThat, Photoshop, Illustrator & Polarian. HCI: UX team,    ~~~~~~~~  , expert reference material, case studies etc.

Project Flavors: Worked on JB Hunt 360 Shipper and JB Hunt 360 Carrier desktop, responsive and Native Mobile App.

JobTitle.Raw: Sr. UX Designer and Agile Coach
JobTitle.Normalized: Senior UX Designer and Agile Coach

Positions.Description:
# Project: # BT and
# Corporate online Mobile website (COL Mobile)

Description:
Westpac Bank one of the leading banking corporation in Australia. Westpac Bank wanted to implement Agile and User Experience functions in internal business project. Being an Agile and UX Coach my role was to act as facilitator for internal projects such as COL (Corporate Online)

Responsibilities: UX Designer
• Heuristic evaluation of existing application and recommend the solutions
• Closely work with product owners and business customer to understand the requirements
• Translate the business requirements into wireframes & with the help of basic user research
• Review Concept design, wireframes and prototypes based on various user journeys
• Information Architecture and Information Design
• Further enhancement of the application based on the feedback received for the prototype

Responsibilities: Agile Coach/Scrum Master
• Conduct daily scrum and clear the impediments if any
• Work with Product Managers to create backlog
• Coach Customer as well as the team members on agile SDLC
• Conduct retrospective meeting with team and customers
• Measure the speed of team and create progress matrix


Environment: Rally (Agile Tool) Word, PowerPoint, Axure, Photoshop, Illustrator & HP Quality Center. HCI: UAT teams,    ~~~~~~~~  , expert reference material, case studies etc.

JobTitle.Raw: Visual Designer and User Experience Designer
JobTitle.Normalized: Visual Designer and User Experience Designer

Positions.Description:
Project: mMortgage (Proposed Product)
Description:
mMortgage a versatile personalized solution on mobile devices (iOS) that enables browsing the properties & mortgage products, bridging the gap between borrower and loan officer.
Responsibilities:
• Defined various personas who could be potential application users, created various user journeys
• Perform quick basic user research with SMEs
• Translate the business requirements into wireframes & with the help of basic user research
• Concept design, wireframes and paper prototypes based on various user journeys
• Information Architecture and Information Design
• Visual Design aligned with brand guidelines
• Effectively communicate design ideas both independently & in teams.
• Creating the interactive prototype and review of the prototype with product and business teams
• Further enhancement of the application based on the feedback received for the prototype
Environment: PowerPoint, Auxure, Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML, CSS (Dreamweaver)

Project: eBudget Web App

Description:
eBudget is a budgeting application created for Project Managers and above. A project manager can perform the budgeting and monitoring of his project application.
Responsibilities:
• Quick application and requirement analysis with onsite
• Understand the basic user research performed by onsite UX team
• Concept design, visual design, information design based on wireframes
• Make sure the Visual Design is aligned with brand guidelines
• Further enhancement of the application based on the feedback received for the visual design
• Design Sitemap & Style guides for developers - structure of layout, visual elements etc.
Environment: PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Dreamweaver)

JobTitle.Normalized: Lead User Experience Designer UX Architect

Positions.Description:
Project: Application Development and eLearning
Project: Application Development.
Role: Lead UX and Visual Designer

Responsibilities:
• Designed and developed UI for applications.
• Lead UI Team: Requirement Analysis, communicate effectively with designers, developers, customers, team members, and upper-management to drive consensus for designs.
• Worked with Business and Product Teams to understand their needs
• Define user interface feature requirements and created document web-based user interface designs that will define how users manage and use the information.
• Involved in user research like contextual interviews, non-directed interview, focus group and requirement gathering & create User Task Flow, Sitemaps.
• Brainstorming sessions with Product Managers, development team
• Effectively communicate design ideas both independently & in teams.
• Develop a coherent design strategy and estimate possible design solutions for problems.
• Design Wireframes, low and high-fidelity prototype, graphic assets using PowerPoint, Photoshop
• Design UI Architecture, User Work Flow, Sitemap, User Interface, Interaction Design, detailed UI specification.
• Present design to the client and even to the end user for feedback.
• Usability Testing like first click test, user interviews.
• Teaming up with cross-functional project teams.
• Improved User experience across the board.

Environment: PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML, CSS and JavaScript (Dreamweaver), JQuery, Rally, SharePoint, Flash, HP QC. HCI: BA, product teams, expert review, case studies, SME inputs, First Click Testing etc.
Project 1: Employee Information Centre (EIC)
Employee Information Center manages the data of all associates (Associates, Managers, AVPS, Directors, VPs, EVPs) working in the Call Center. It not only maintains all the data (performance and training) related to associates but also maintains a Hierarchical model to facilitate the modifications quickly and easily.
A typical user can see
• The record of all associates working a level below in Hierarchy
• Home page with at a glance view and detail view
• Profile which holds the information about attendance, performance and training

The other important feature of EIC is its role based view for Associate, Manager and AVPs etc.
EIC was recognized as one of the 4 benchmark projects in SCUSA IT Annual meet Jan 2013 and awarded as Project in Focus 2013.


Project 2: Campaign Manager (CM)
CM is used for managing campaigns which are sent with the monthly bills to the customer every month. The application is used to manage (add/edit/modify) campaign.
A typical user can
• Search campaigns
• Setup campaigns
• Manage the alerts on the bill and inserts
• Manage campaign templates
• Edit campaign priorities

Project 3: Call Quality Management (CQM)
CQM is used for evaluating calls, web submission and live chat (web submission and live chat functions were added later as client was impressed by quality of application)
A typical user can
• Search calls
• web submissions and live chat
• Evaluate calls, view and edit evaluated calls
• Manage disputes
• animations to show processes to make

# SharePoint Migration
SharePoint Migration 2003 to 2010
UX team was involved in SharePoint Branding and UI customization. SCUSA wanted to use SharePoint as their intranet portal. Portlets were created for each department and were customized based on the need of each department. SharePoint UI was completely customized to give a portal look.

Project: Training and online learning platform:
Design and Development of eLearning Modules for new hires as well as experienced associates with supportive animations, illustrations and interactive exercises for
➢ Wholesale Floor Planning
➢ Leasing
➢ Products and Programs etc.
All modules have
➢ uniform UI to navigate within
➢ clearly defined objective and summary
➢ periodic knowledge checks
➢ interactivity to increase users involvement
➢ Supportive conceptual visual
➢ Animations to show processes to make

Responsibilities: (Team Lead for Onsite and Offshore)
• Conducted workshops with customers and other stakeholders on regular basis for requirement, expectations and define priorities.
• Weekly presentations and demo with customer to showcase the development, project progress and seek feedback.
• Visual Design: Initial concept/high level design (screen layout, animation, interactivity, Logo, UI etc) for all learning modules.
• Share the concept designs with offshore for further development through scribbles, concept designs or Visual Storyboard.
• Functional prototype design with the help of team.
• Planning, Estimating effort and Schedule the work based on priorities assign appropriate work to team on timely manner.
• Monitor the daily progress of work and seek immediate solutions in case of any issues. Thorough review of deliverables and make sure the quality is up to the mark. Log the defects/observations in log sheet and ensure the issues are fixed.
• Make sure customer get better User Experience through the training modules delivered and the objective of the training module is achieved.
• QA and testing of the course hosted on LMS.
• Roll out the course for UAT, seek feedback.
• Update and send the course to be hosted on LMS to concerned team
• Ensuring proper utilization of recourses.
• Appraising performance of subordinates on half yearly basis.
• Onsite-Offshore coordination through daily tele conference

Environment: Story Board (MS Word), PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator, Captivate, Audition, CornerStone (LMS), Rally and Flash.

JobTitle.Raw: Visual Designer and User Experience Designer
JobTitle.Normalized: Visual Designer and User Experience Designer

Positions.Description:
Project: Corporate Directory
Description:
Corporate Directory is web based tool which gives the details of any given associates like, Project, Work Location, Contact Details, Complete Hierarchy, Cost Center etc. One can search Associate using Last Name, First Name or Phone number, Location etc. Associate details open in from of a visiting card. Location map functionality was also developed for the tool. The tool was developed using Adobe Flex.
Responsibilities:
• Defined various personas who could be potential application users, created various user journeys
• Involved in user research, requirement gathering & create User Task Flow, Sitemaps.
• Brainstorm & design wireframes, prototype and graphic assets using Photoshop.

Environment: Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator, Flex, Flash.

Project: Rx Connect
Description:
Rx Connect is a CVS pharmacy operating system. User centered design approach was followed in Design and development of Rx Connect. A special Usability Lab was established to test the system. Various users were invited to test the application for the satisfaction, efficiency, effectiveness.
Responsibilities:
• Requirement Analysis, Project Communication, participation in Client's meeting and defining strategy & goals
• Extensive user research through contextual interviews, formal discussions, focus groups and personas
• Design User Work Flow, User Interface, Interaction flow, detailed Functional & UI specification Involved in user research, requirement gathering & create User Task Flow, Sitemaps.
• Brainstorm & design wireframes, prototype and graphic assets using Photoshop.
• Usability testing: Various users were called to Usability Lab to test how effectively they are able to use the new application. The Usability testing was conducted using TechSmith Morae.
Environment: Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, TechSmith Morae, Extensive Usability testing in Usability Lab HCI: BA, product teams, expert review, case studies, SME inputs etc.

From Feb 2005 to Jan 2008 I work on various eLearning projects with esteemed customers like Microsoft, GE, Bank of America, The Home Depot, SABIC Industries (Saudi Arabia), Mckinsey & Company. Though the projects were different but I played role of Graphic Designer or Lead Designer. Typically following were my duties.
• User Interface development from Hi-level to low level using paper prototypes, wireframes and concept design.
• Visual Storyboarding wherever necessary
• Visual Designing of the selected User Interface using Photoshop
• Functional prototyping to give an idea about the look and feel and functionality of the application
• Designing and development of Animations using Flash and Photoshop
• Graphic component development (Creating Icons) using Flash and Photoshop
• Updating the graphic elements based on the feedback given by the client using Photoshop and Flash
• Sound integration and voice over synchronization of all screens used in the course
• Review of all graphical elements and animation developed for the course by design team of the project
• Integration of all graphical elements in flash
• Testing and quality control and of the entire course
Mar 2005 to July 2005, Role: Graphic Designer

Achievements: EIC was recognized as one of the 4 benchmark projects in SCUSA IT Annual meet Jan 2013 and awarded as Project in Focus 2013
QualificationsSummary:
TECHNICAL SKILLS
Design Skills
• Heuristic Evaluation
• Wireframes
• Storyboard / Paper Prototypes
• Concept Design
• Information Architecture
• Interactive Prototypes
• Visual Design
• Mobile Design

Tools
• Sketch, Axure
• Invision
• Balsamic
• Adobe Photoshop / Illustrator
• UX Pin
• Fireworks / Dreamweaver
• PowerPoint
• HTML5/ CSS3
• Basic JavaScript

UX Research Skills
• Contextual Inquiry
• Focus Groups
• Non directed interviews
• Competitive Analysis
• Surveys/ Usability Testing

Findings.Message: A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have a job title.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
It is very rare to be currently employed at the same company under two different jobs. One of these positions is likely missing an end date or formatted poorly.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'TECHNICAL SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

Project 1: Employee Information Centre (EIC)
Employee Information Center manages the data of all associates (Associates, Managers, AVPS, Directors, VPs, EVPs) working in the Call Center. It not only maintains all the data (performance and training) related to associates but also maintains a Hierarchical model to facilitate the modifications quickly and easily.
A typical user can see
• The record of all associates working a level below in Hierarchy
• Home page with at a glance view and detail view
• Profile which holds the information about attendance, performance and training

The other important feature of EIC is its role based view for Associate, Manager and AVPs etc.
EIC was recognized as one of the 4 benchmark projects in SCUSA IT Annual meet Jan 2013 and awarded as Project in Focus 2013.


Project 2: Campaign Manager (CM)
CM is used for managing campaigns which are sent with the monthly bills to the customer every month. The application is used to manage (add/edit/modify) campaign.
A typical user can
• Search campaigns
• Setup campaigns
• Manage the alerts on the bill and inserts
• Manage campaign templates
• Edit campaign priorities

Project 3: Call Quality Management (CQM)
CQM is used for evaluating calls, web submission and live chat (web submission and live chat functions were added later as client was impressed by quality of application)
A typical user can
• Search calls
• web submissions and live chat
• Evaluate calls, view and edit evaluated calls
• Manage disputes
• animations to show processes to make

# SharePoint Migration
SharePoint Migration 2003 to 2010
UX team was involved in SharePoint Branding and UI customization. SCUSA wanted to use SharePoint as their intranet portal. Portlets were created for each department and were customized based on the need of each department. SharePoint UI was completely customized to give a portal look.

Project: Training and online learning platform:
Design and Development of eLearning Modules for new hires as well as experienced associates with supportive animations, illustrations and interactive exercises for
➢ Wholesale Floor Planning
➢ Leasing
➢ Products and Programs etc.
All modules have
➢ uniform UI to navigate within
➢ clearly defined objective and summary
➢ periodic knowledge checks
➢ interactivity to increase users involvement
➢ Supportive conceptual visual
➢ Animations to show processes to make
